title: Semantics. Volume 1.
subject: Semantics$$QSemantics -- Handbooks, manuals, etc
Sémantique$$QSémantique -- Guides, manuels, etc
Semantics
Languages & Literatures
Philology & Linguistics
creator: Maienborn, Claudia.$$QMaienborn, Claudia.
description: The series Handbooks of Linguistics and Communication Science is designed to illuminate a field which not only includes general linguistics and the study of linguistics as applied to specific languages, but also covers those more recent areas which have developed from the increasing body of research into the manifold forms of communicative action and interaction.
contents: I. Foundations of semantics -- 1. Meaning in linguistics · Claudia Maienborn, Klaus von Heusinger and Paul Portner -- 2. Meaning, intentionality and communication · Pierre Jacob -- 3. (Frege on) Sense and reference · Mark Textor -- 4. Reference: Foundational issues · Barbara Abbott -- 5. Meaning in language use · Georgia M. Green -- 6. Compositionality · Peter Pagin and Dag Westerståhl -- 7. Lexical decomposition: Foundational issues · Stefan Engelberg -- II. History of semantics -- 8. Meaning in pre-19th century thought · Stephan Meier-Oeser -- 9. The emergence of linguistic semantics in the 19th and early 20th century · Brigitte Nerlich -- 10. The infl uence of logic on semantics · Albert Newen and Bernhard Schröder -- 11. Formal semantics and representationalism · Ruth Kempson -- III. Methods in semantic research -- 12. Varieties of semantic evidence · Manfred Krifka -- 13. Methods in cross-linguistic semantics · Lisa Matthewson -- 14. Formal methods in semantics · Alice G.B. ter Meulen -- 15. The application of experimental methods in semantics · Oliver Bott, Sam Featherston, Janina Radó and Britta Stolterfoht -- IV. Lexical semantics -- 16. Semantic features and primes · Manfred Bierwisch -- 17. Frameworks of lexical decomposition of verbs · Stefan Engelberg -- 18. Thematic roles · Anthony R. Davis -- 19. Lexical Conceptual Structure · Beth Levin and Malka Rappaport Hovav -- 20. Idioms and collocations · Christiane Fellbaum -- 21. Sense relations · Ronnie Cann -- 22. Dual oppositions in lexical meaning · Sebastian Löbner -- V. Ambiguity and vagueness -- 23. Ambiguity and vagueness: An overview · Christopher Kennedy -- 24. Semantic underspecifi cation · Markus Egg -- 25. Mismatches and coercion · Henriëtte de Swart.

26. Metaphors and metonymies · Andrea Tyler and Hiroshi Takahashi -- VI. Cognitively oriented approaches to semantics -- 27. Cognitive Semantics: An overview · Leonard Talmy -- 28. Prototype theory · John R. Taylor -- 29. Frame Semantics · Jean Mark Gawron -- 30. Conceptual Semantics · Ray Jackendoff -- 31. Two-level Semantics: Semantic Form and Conceptual Structure · Ewald Lang and Claudia Maienborn -- 32. Word meaning and world knowledge · Jerry R. Hobbs -- VII. Theories of sentence semantics -- 33. Model-theoretic semantics · Thomas Ede Zimmermann -- 34. Event semantics · Claudia Maienborn -- 35. Situation Semantics and the ontology of natural language · Jonathan Ginzburg -- VIII. Theories of discourse semantics -- 36. Situation Semantics: From indexicality to metacommunicative interaction · Jonathan Ginzburg -- 37. Discourse Representation Theory · Hans Kamp and Uwe Reyle -- 38. Dynamic semantics · Paul Dekker -- 39. Rhetorical relations · Henk Zeevat.

abstract: The series Handbooks of Linguistics and Communication Science is designed to illuminate a field which not only includes general linguistics and the study of linguistics as applied to specific languages, but also covers those more recent areas which have developed from the increasing body of research into the manifold forms of communicative action and interaction.
